lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _meowmeow_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/meowmeow.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run meowmeow.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

*

The Meowmeow class is the main class of the program.

*

This class is used to run the program.
* @param filePath is a String that specifies the filepath of the save file.
* Main method that runs the program.

*

Class MeowmeowException is a concrete class that extends the Exception class.

*

This class is used to create an exception when the user enters an invalid command.

*

This class is a concrete class because it has an implementation.
* @param message the message to be displayed to the user.
* Method that returns the message to be displayed to the user.
* @return the message to be displayed to the user.
throw new MeowmeowException("Sowwie meowmeow doesn't understand what you said uwu");
System.out.println("Sowwie meowmeow doesn't understand what you said uwu");
throw new MeowmeowException("Meowmeow can't throw away a task that doesn't exist =owo=");
System.out.println("Meowmeow has thrown this task into the void!! (=^>w<^=) \n"
System.out.println("You have " + numOfInputs + " tasks left now Owo");
throw new MeowmeowException("Meowmeow needs a name for the task you want to add (=^0w0^=)");
System.out.println("(=^-w-^=) " + t + " has been added to your task list!\n");
throw new MeowmeowException("=0w0= To add a deadline type it in in this format: "
System.out.println("(=^-w-^=) " + d + " has been added to your task list!\n");
throw new MeowmeowException("=0w0= To add an event type it in in this format: event taskName /at time");
System.out.println("(=^-w-^=) " + e + " has been added to your task list!\n");
System.out.println("Good job (=OwO=) You finished this task! \n" + task);
throw new MeowmeowException("Meowmeow there isn't a task with that number uwu");
System.out.println("uwu this task has been marked as not done... \n" + task);
throw new MeowmeowException("Meowmeow there isn't a task with that number uwu");
throw new MeowmeowException("Meowmeow can't find any tasks that contain these words (=^0w0^=)");
String intro = "Hewwo! I'm\n" + name + "\nWhat do you need meow to do?";

*

Class AddCommand is a concrete class that implements the Command interface.

*

This class is used to add a task to the task list.

*

This class is a concrete class because it has an implementation.
* @param taskType the type of task to be added.
*                 'T' for todo, 'D' for deadline, 'E' for event.
* @param userInput the user input to be added.
*                  The user input can contain the name of the task and the date and time of the task.
* @param tasks the task list to be operated on by the command.
*              The task list is used to add the task to the task list.
* @param ui the user interface to be used by the command.
*           The user interface is used to display the result of the command.
* @param storage the storage to be used by the command.
*                The storage is used to save and load the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* isExit method that returns false for AddCommand.

*

This class is the superclass of all commands.

*

This class is abstract because it has no implementation.
* @param tasks the task list to be operated on by the command.
* @param ui the user interface to be used by the command.
* @param storage the storage to be used by the command.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Method that returns true if the command is an exit command.
* @return true if the command is an exit command.

*

Class DefaultCommand is a concrete class that implements the Command interface.

*

This class is used when the user enters an invalid command.

*

This class is a concrete class because it has an implementation.
* @param tasks the task list to be operated on by the command.
*              The task list is used to add the task to the task list.
* @param ui the user interface to be used by the command.
*           The user interface is used to display the result of the command.
* @param storage the storage to be used by the command.
*                The storage is used to save and load the task list.
*     Prints an error message to the user interface.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* isExit method that returns false for DefaultCommand.

*

Class DeleteCommand is a concrete class that implements the Command interface.

*

This class is used to delete a task from the task list.

*

This class is a concrete class because it has an implementation.
* @param taskNum the number of the task to be deleted.
* @param tasks the task list to be operated on by the command.
*              The task list is used to delete the task from the task list.
* @param ui the user interface to be used by the command.
*           The user interface is used to display the result of the command.
* @param storage the storage to be used by the command.
*                The storage is used to save and load the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* isExit method that returns false for DeleteCommand.

*

Class ExitCommand is a concrete class that implements the Command interface.

*

This class is used when the user enters the bye command.

*

This class is a concrete class because it has an implementation.
* Prints a goodbye message to the user interface.
* @param tasks the task list to be operated on by the command.
*              The task list is used to delete the task from the task list.
* @param ui the user interface to be used by the command.
*           The user interface is used to display the result of the command.
* @param storage the storage to be used by the command.
*                The storage is used to save and load the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
System.out.println("UwU Byebyeeee! Come back soon... Meowmeow misses you already =^._.^= ");
* isExit method that returns true for ExitCommand.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

*

Class ListCommand is a concrete class that implements the Command interface.

*

This class is used when the user enters the "list" command.

*

This class is a concrete class because it has an implementation.
* Prints out the tasks in the task list to the user interface.
* @param tasks the task list to be operated on by the command.
*              The task list is used to delete the task from the task list.
* @param ui the user interface to be used by the command.
*           The user interface is used to display the result of the command.
* @param storage the storage to be used by the command.
*                The storage is used to save and load the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* isExit method that returns false for ListCommand.

*

Class MarkCommand is a concrete class that implements the Command interface.

*

This class is used to mark a task as completed or unmark tasks in the task list.

*

This class is a concrete class because it has an implementation.
* @param isDone true if the task is to be marked as completed, false if the task is to be marked as incomplete.
* @param taskNum the number of the task to be marked.
* @param tasks the task list to be operated on by the command.
*              The task list is used to mark the task as completed or incomplete.
* @param ui the user interface to be used by the command.
*           The user interface is used to display the result of the command.
* @param storage the storage to be used by the command.
*                The storage is used to save and load the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* isExit method that returns false for MarkCommand.

*

Class Deadline is a concrete class that extends the Task class.

*

This class is used to create a task with a deadline.

*

This class is a concrete class because it has an implementation.
* @param taskName the name of the task.
* @param date the date and time of the task.
* Method that returns a String showing the date and time of the task.
* @return a String showing the date and time and completion status of the task.
* Method that returns the date and time of the task in a special format for creating a save file.
* @return a String showing the date and time and completion status of the task.

*

Class Event is a concrete class that extends the Task class.

*

This class is used to create a task that is an event.

*

This class is a concrete class because it has an implementation.
* @param taskName the name of the task.
* @param time the time of the task.
* Method that returns a String showing the time and completion status of the task.
* @return a String showing the time and completion status of the task.
* Method that returns the time and completion status of the task in a special format for creating a save file.
* @return a String showing the time and completion status of the task.

*

Task class is the parent class of the ToDo, Deadline and Event classes.

*

This class is used to create a task.

*

This class is a concrete class because it has an implementation.
* @param taskName the name of the task.
* Method that marks the task as done.
* Method that marks the task as not done.
* Method that returns a boolean showing whether the task is done or not.
* @return a boolean showing whether the task is done or not.
* Method that returns the name and completion status of the task.
* @return the name and completion status of the task.
* Method that returns the name and completion status of the task in a special format for creating a save file.
* @return the name and completion status of the task.

*

Class ToDos is a concrete class that extends the Task class.

*

This class is used to create a task that is a to-do.

*

This class is a concrete class because it has an implementation.
* @param taskName the name of the task.
* Method that returns a String showing the completion status of the task.
* @return a String showing the completion status of the task.
* Method that returns the completion status of the task in a special format for creating a save file.
* @return a String showing the completion status of the task.
Deadline d = new Deadline("Drink milk", date);
String expected = " D | false | Drink milk | 2020-01-01T23:59:59";
Deadline d = new Deadline("Drink milk", date);
String expected = "[D] [ ] Drink milk (by: 11:59 PM on 01/01/2020)";
